title: eRah Manual
text: eRah automatically detects deconvolves spectra compounds appearing GC–MS chromatograms. eRah processes raw data files (netCDF mzXML) complete metabolomics experiment automated manner. , compounds aligned spectral similarity retention time distance. eRah computes Euclidean distance retention time distance spectral similarity compounds chromatograms, resulting compounds appearing across maximum number samples least retention time spectral distance. Also, (optional) missing compound recovery step, can applied recover compounds missing samples. Missing compounds appear result incorrect deconvolution alignment - due low compound concentration sample - , present sample. forces final data table compound names compounds area, missing (zero) values. Finally, identification found metabolites conducted. mean spectra group aligned compounds compared reference library. eRah includes custom version MassBank repository. libraries can imported eRah (e.g., Golm Metabolome Database), eRah’s deconvolved spectra can exported comparison NIST library.

what: GC–MS Data Processing with eRah: a tutorial
title: eRah Manual
text: section show processing example samples spike-experiment designed interrogating data processing methods gcspikelite data package (Robinson 2018) analyzed using GC–MS. sample set consists nine samples three triplicate classes. gcspikelite package can installed bioconductor using BiocManager package: package necessary data can loaded using: tutorial shows deconvolve, align identify compounds contained samples. listed commands (script) reproduce following demo can found executing: click User guides, package vignettes documentation source ’eRah Manual’.
code: install.packages('BiocManager') BiocManager::install('gcspikelite') library(gcspikelite) data("targets") library(erah) help(package = "erah")

title: eRah Manual
text: Using input method first load file paths given data set. example data set gcspikelite package can : files contains vector file paths nine .CDF files needed processing. instrumental information table can created using following: columns containing additional sample instrumental information can also added table. Next can optionally define class phenotype information sample set. can done using following, providing vector classes names associated file. Ensure order class affiliations match file paths. Similarly instrumental table, columns containing additional sample instrumental information can also added. new experiment can setup using instrumental phenotype tables : experiment name can defined using info argument. creates new MetaboSet object used storing sample metadata processing results.
code: files <- list.files(system.file('data',package = 'gcspikelite'),full.names = TRUE) files <- files[sapply(files,grepl,pattern = 'CDF')] instrumental <- createInstrumentalTable(files) classes <- as.character(targets$Group[order(targets$FileName)]) phenotype <- createPhenoTable(files, cls = classes) ex <- newExp(instrumental = instrumental,              phenotype = phenotype,               info = "DEMO Experiment")

previous_headings: GC–MS Data Processing with eRah: a tutorial
title: eRah Manual
text: compounds data deconvolved using deconvolveComp(). function requires Deconvolution parameters object, can created setDecPar function, containing parameters algorithm shown follows: peak width value (seconds) critical parameter conditions efficiency eRah, also masses exclude important role GC–MS-based metabolomics experiments. Peak width parameter: typically, value less half mean compound width. experiment, average peak width 2 2.5 seconds, selected 1 second peak width. lower parameter set , sensibility deconvolve co-eluted compounds, also may increase number false positive compounds. set low algorithm generate false positives compounds, usually means one single compound detected twice. parameter value increased, algorithm may fail separate co-eluted compounds, leading generate less false positives loosing capacity detection. Masses exclude: masses m/z 73, 74, 75, 147, 148, 149 recommended excluded processing subsequent steps, since ubiquitous mass fragments typically generated compounds carrying trimethylsilyl moiety. samples derivatized, including masses hamper deconvolution process; important number compounds share masses leading poorer selectivity compounds. Also, complex GC–MS-based metabolomics samples, also recommend excluding masses 1 69 Da, reasons. masses generated compounds groups common large number compounds metabolomics, leading poorer selectivity compounds. Although masses also intense m/z compounds spectra, eRah automatically set used library’s masses zero, affect spectral matching identification. eRah also supports parallel processing step using future package. enables faster processing large sample sets. default, deconvolution done file sequentially. However, parallel processing can activated prior specifying parallel backend using plan(). following example specifies using multisession backend (muliple background R sessions) two worker processes. See future package documentation information types parallel backends available. samples can deconvolved using: Data can saved loaded stage process :
code: ex.dec.par <- setDecPar(min.peak.width = 1,                         avoid.processing.mz = c(35:69,73:75,147:149)) plan(future::multisession,workers = 2) ex <- deconvolveComp(ex, ex.dec.par) ##  ##  Deconvolving compounds from /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gcspikelite/data/0709_468.CDF ... Processing 1 / 9 ##  ##  Deconvolving compounds from /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gcspikelite/data/0709_470.CDF ... Processing 2 / 9 ##  ##  Deconvolving compounds from /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gcspikelite/data/0709_471.CDF ... Processing 3 / 9 ##  ##  Deconvolving compounds from /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gcspikelite/data/0709_474.CDF ... Processing 4 / 9 ##  ##  Deconvolving compounds from /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gcspikelite/data/0709_475.CDF ... Processing 5 / 9 ##  ##  Deconvolving compounds from /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gcspikelite/data/0709_479.CDF ... Processing 6 / 9 ##  ##  Deconvolving compounds from /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gcspikelite/data/0709_485.CDF ... Processing 7 / 9 ##  ##  Deconvolving compounds from /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gcspikelite/data/0709_493.CDF ... Processing 8 / 9 ##  ##  Deconvolving compounds from /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/gcspikelite/data/0709_496.CDF ... Processing 9 / 9 ## Compounds deconvolved ex ## A "MetaboSet" object containing 9 samples  ##   ## Data processed with  ## Info attached to this experiment:  ##  DEMO Experiment save(ex, file = "testPCOS.rda") # Load load("testPCOS.rda")

title: eRah Manual
text: Alignment executed alignComp(). parameters also set prior . parameters min.spectra.cor, max.time.dist mz.range. min.spectra.cor (Minimum spectral correlation) value - 0 (non similar) 1 (similar) - sets similar two compounds considered alignment . can restrictive parameter, one compound detected samples, can retrieve later ’missing compound recovery’ step. Also, impose maximum disalignment distance 3 seconds (max.time.dist). value (seconds) sets far two compounds can considered alignment . mz.range range masses considered comparing spectra. set masses 70 600 taken account, reasons commented ’Masses exclude’ point. Alignment can performed : Aligning large ammout samples: experiments containing 100 (Windows) 1000 (Mac Linux) samples, alignment lead errors show poor run-time performance. cases alignment can conducted block segmentation. details alignComp() access help using ?alignComp can decide execute missing compound recovery step (retrieve compounds missing values - found - certain samples) also identify compounds without applying recMissComp(). words, missing compound recovery step optional. , apply missing recovery step later identify compounds.
code: ex.al.par <- setAlPar(min.spectra.cor = 0.90, max.time.dist = 3, mz.range = 70:600) ex <- alignComp(ex, alParameters = ex.al.par)  ex ## A "MetaboSet" object containing 9 samples  ##   ## Data processed with  ## Info attached to this experiment:  ##  DEMO Experiment

text: missing compound recovery step requires indicate number minimum values compound wants ’re-searched’ samples. compound appears least samples minimum samples value (min.samples), , compound searched rest samples concentration registered. : Missing compound recovery: min.samples parameter sets number samples total number samples. Also, parameter large, alignment dimension number samples experiment. set low, higher number false positives expected. recommended strategy first evaluate average number samples compounds appear, executeing alignList () idList() - identified - functions (explained following sections). Warning: already identified compounds, always re-identify compounds executing missing compound recovery step, byidentifyComp(), explained following sections.
code: ex <- recMissComp(ex, min.samples = 6) ##  ##  Updating alignment table...  ## Model fitted! ex ## A "MetaboSet" object containing 9 samples  ##   ## Data processed with  ## Info attached to this experiment:  ##  DEMO Experiment

text: final processing step identify previously aligned compounds assign putative name. eRah compares spectra found reference database. package includes custom version MassBank MS library, selected default database functions. However, strongly encourage use Golm Metabolome Database (GMD). GMD importation described following sections. Identification can executed identifyComp, accessed idList follows:
code: ex <- identifyComp(ex) ## Constructing matrix database...  ## Comparing spectra...  ## Done! id.list <- idList(ex) head(id.list[,1:4], n = 8) ## # A tibble: 8 × 4 ##   AlignID tmean FoundIn Name.1                              ##     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>                               ## 1      13  5.79       9 Harmaline (1TMS)                    ## 2      17  5.88       9 2-Hydroxypyridine                   ## 3      16  5.96       9 2-Hydroxypyridine                   ## 4      25  6.08       9 2'-Deoxyadenosine (3TMS)            ## 5      27  6.18       9 2,3-Bisphospho-glycerate            ## 6      35  6.36       9 DL-2,3-Diaminopropionic acid (2TMS) ## 7      39  6.50       9 (R)-(-)-Phenylephrine (2TMS)        ## 8      44  6.63       9 Malonic acid (2TMS)

previous_headings: Importing and customizing mass spectral libraries
title: eRah Manual
text: Users may import mass spectral libraries. strongly recommend using Golm Metabolome Database (GMD) eRah. use GMD, first, download webpage, downloading file ”GMD 20111121 VAR5 ALK MSP.txt” ”GMD 20111121 MDN35 ALK MSP.txt”, depending type chromatographic columns (VAR5 MDN35) using. interested using retention index information, files can used indistinctly. , can load library function importMSP(): can substitute default eRah database object mslib, custom database, following code: allows executing functions without need always setting library parameter. replace mslib object shown , use new library (case golm.database) functions, example:
code: g.info <- " GOLM Metabolome Database ------------------------ Kopka, J., Schauer, N., Krueger, S., Birkemeyer, C., Usadel, B., Bergmuller, E., Dor- mann, P., Weckwerth, W., Gibon, Y., Stitt, M., Willmitzer, L., Fernie, A.R. and Stein- hauser, D. (2005) GMD.CSB.DB: the Golm Metabolome Database, Bioinformatics, 21, 1635- 1638."  golm.database <- importGMD(filename="GMD_20111121_VAR5_ALK_MSP.txt",                             DB.name="GMD",                             DB.version="GMD_20111121",                             DB.info= g.info,type="VAR5.ALK")  # The library in R format can now be stored for a posterior faster loading save(golm.database, file= "golmdatabase.rda") load("golmdatabase.rda") mslib <- golm.database findComp(name = "phenol", id.database = golm.database)

what: Automated Spectral Deconvolution, Alignment, and Metabolite Identification in GC/MS-Based Untargeted Metabolomics
title: Automated Spectral Deconvolution, Alignment, and Metabolite Identification in GC/MS-Based Untargeted Metabolomics
text: Automated compound deconvolution, alignment across samples, identification metabolites spectral library matching Gas Chromatography - Mass spectrometry (GC-MS) untargeted metabolomics. Outputs table compound names, matching scores integrated area compound sample. Domingo-Almenara, X., Brezmes, J., Vinaixa, M., Samino, S., Ramirez, N., Ramon-Krauel, M., Lerin, C., Díaz, M., Ibáñez, L., Correig, X. Perera-Lluna, ., 2016. eRah: computational tool integrating spectral deconvolution alignment quantification identification metabolites GC/MS-based metabolomics. Analytical Chemistry, 88(19), pp.9821-9829. eRah development version. downloads, please use CRAN https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=erah

title: Automated Spectral Deconvolution, Alignment, and Metabolite Identification in GC/MS-Based Untargeted Metabolomics

title: Automated Spectral Deconvolution, Alignment, and Metabolite Identification in GC/MS-Based Untargeted Metabolomics
text: package documentation can browsed online https://xdomingoal.github.io/erah-devel/. first time using erah see manual information get started. believe ’ve found bug erah, please file bug (, possible, reproducible example) https://github.com/xdomingoal/erah-devel/issues.

title: Class
text: MetaboSet class single generic class valid sorts metabolomic studies regardless experimental platform, statistical processing annotation stage. core operation class eRah.

title: Class
text: MetaboSet

title: Class
text: Info Slot Info stores general information experiment experimental platform used analysis biological samples. Data Slot Data contains either raw data path files. also contains list selected features (deconvolved compounds). subslot Parameters saved information regarding feature selector algorithm (type, parameters, version...) experimental platform used. MetaData Slot MetaData two slots. Instrumental slot saved data frame mandatory fields (filename, date, time, sampleID) optional fields related experimental platform (Column ID, Column Type, Ioniser,...). Slot Phenotypic contains data frame sample experimental information (phenotypes, longitudinal data,...). Results Results slot saved information related statistical identification results. slot Parameters contains values parameters used identification statistical functions. Slot Identification results identification process well identification /annotation steps. results statistical functions saved Statistics slot.

title: Class
text: Xavier Domingo-Almenara, Arnald Alonso Francesc Fernandez-Albert.

title: Class
text: RawDataParameters class contains slots storing accessing MS sample, essential parameters performing processing (deconvolution).

title: Class
text: data data matrix sample processed min.mz minimum adquired mz number max.mz maximum adquired mz number start.time Starting time adquisition mz.resolution Mz resolution scans.per.second Scans per second avoid.processing.mz mz processed min.peak.width Minimum peak width (stored scans) min.peak.height Minimum peak height noise.threshold noise threshold compression.coef Compression coefficient (parameter Orthogonal Signal Deconvolution)

title: Class
text: Xavier Domingo-Almenara.

title: Alignment of compounds — alignComp
text: Experiment 'MetaboSet' S4 object containing experiment data previously created newExp deconvolved deconvolveComp. alParameters software alignment parameters object previously created setAlPar blocks.size experiment 1000 samples, depending computer, alignment can conducted block segmentation. See details.

title: Alignment of compounds — alignComp
text: function returns updated S4 'MetaboSet' class, GC-MS samples now aligned.

title: Alignment of compounds — alignComp
text: See eRah vignette details. open vignette, execute following code R: vignette("eRahManual", package="erah") experiments containing 100 (Windows) 1000 (Mac Linux) samples (numbers depending computer resoures sample type). cases alignment can conducted block segmentation. experiment e.g. 1000 samples, block.size can set 100, alignment perform multiple (ten) 100-samples experiments, later align single experiment. parameter designed solve typical problem appear aligning Windows operating system: "Error: allocate vector size XX Gb". problem appear Mac Linux, several hours computation expected aligning large number samples. Using block segmentation provides greatly improved run-time performance.

title: Alignment list — alignList
text: object 'MetaboSet' S4 object containing experiment data. experiment previously deconvolved, aligned (optionally) identified. .area TRUE (default), eRah outputs quantification area deconvolved chromatographic peak compound. FALSE, eRah outputs intensity deconvolved chromatographic peak.

title: Alignment list — alignList
text: alignList returns data frame object: AlignID unique Tag found metabolite eRah. metabolite found eRah given experiment unique AlignID tag number. Factor Factor tag name. metabolite unique 'Factor' name enhance visual interpretation. tmean mean compound retention time. FoundIn number samples compound detected (number samples compound area non-zero). Quantification many columns samples many rows metabolites, column name name sample.

text: Returns alignment table containing list aligned metabolites relative quantification sample given experiment.

code: library(gcspikelite)  files <- list.files(system.file('data',package = 'gcspikelite'),full.names = TRUE) files <- files[sapply(files,grepl,pattern = 'CDF')]  instrumental <- createInstrumentalTable(files)

text: Creates phenotype information table based experiment sample file paths sample classes. Columns containing information can also added .

title: Create Phenotype Table — createPhenoTable
code: library(gcspikelite) data(targets)  files <- list.files(system.file('data',package = 'gcspikelite'),full.names = TRUE) files <- files[sapply(files,grepl,pattern = 'CDF')]  phenotype <- createPhenoTable(files,as.character(targets$Group[order(targets$FileName)]))

title: Creating Experiment Tables — createdt
text: eRah requires instrumental (optionally) phenotype .csv file starting/creating new eRah project/experiment. function automatically creates Phenoytpe Instrumental data .csv files.

title: Creating Experiment Tables — createdt
code: createdt(path)

title: Creating Experiment Tables — createdt
text: path path experiment-folder (experiment samples stored).

title: Creating Experiment Tables — createdt
text: experiment organized follows: samples related class stored folder (one folder = one class), class-folders one folder, experiment folder. Two things considered step: .csv files different created American European computers, errors may raise due fact. Also, folder containing samples, must contain folders. folder contains files (example, already created .csv files), eRah prompt error. See eRah vignette details. open vignette, execute following code R:  vignette("eRahManual", package="erah")

title: Creating Experiment Tables — createdt
code: if (FALSE) { # Store all the raw data files in one different folder per class, # and all the class-folders in one folder, which is the experiment # folder. Then execute  createdt(path)  # where path is the experiment folder path. # The experiment can be now startd by:  ex <- newExp(instrumental="path/DEMO_inst.csv",  phenotype="path/DEMO_pheno.csv", info="DEMO Experiment") }

title: Data list — dataList
text: final eRah list aligned identified metabolites relative quantification sample given experiment

title: Data list — dataList
code: dataList(Experiment, id.database = mslib, by.area = TRUE)  # S4 method for MetaboSet dataList(Experiment, id.database = mslib, by.area = TRUE)

title: Data list — dataList
text: Experiment 'MetaboSet' S4 object containing experiment data. experiment previously deconvolved, aligned identified. id.database mass-spectra library compared empirical spectra. default, MassBank - Mass Bank North America (MoNa) database employed (mslib object). .area TRUE (default), eRah outputs quantification area deconvolved chromatographic peak compound. FALSE, eRah outputs intensity deconvolved chromatographic peak.

title: Data list — dataList
text: alignList returns S3 object: AlignID unique Tag found metabolite eRah. metabolite found eRah given experiment unique AlignID tag number. tmean mean compound retention time. FoundIn number samples compound detected (number samples compound area non-zero). Name.X name Xst/nd/rd... hit. idList return many X (hits) n.putative selected identifyComp. MatchFactor.X match factor/score spectral similarity (spectral correlation). DB.Id.X identification number library. metbolite reference library different DB.Id number. CAS.X CAS number identified metabolite. Quantification many columns samples many rows metabolites, column name name sample.

title: Data list — dataList
text: Returns identification alignment table containing list aligned identifed metabolites (names) relative quantification sample given experiment.

what: Deconvolution of compounds in samples — deconvolveComp
title: Deconvolution of compounds in samples — deconvolveComp
text: Deconvolution GC-MS data

title: Deconvolution of compounds in samples — deconvolveComp
code: deconvolveComp(   Experiment,   decParameters,   samples.to.process = NULL,   down.sample = FALSE,   virtualScansPerSecond = NULL )  # S4 method for MetaboSet deconvolveComp(   Experiment,   decParameters,   samples.to.process = NULL,   down.sample = FALSE,   virtualScansPerSecond = NULL )

title: Deconvolution of compounds in samples — deconvolveComp
text: Experiment 'MetaboSet' S4 object containing experiment data previously created newExp. decParameters software deconvolution parameters object previously created setDecPar samples..process Vector indicating samples processed. .sample TRUE, chromatograms sampled define one peak 10 scan points (according minimum peak width). process longer chromatograms wider peak widths (20 seconds peak width small scans per second values). See details. virtualScansPerSecond virtual scans per second. chromatograms downsampled (example, 1 mean peak width 1 scans per second sampling frequency used), eRah perform expected. cases, BEST solution re-acquire samples. However, selecting different (virtual) scans per second frequency, eRah can upsample data process effectively.

title: Deconvolution of compounds in samples — deconvolveComp
text: function returns updated S4 'MetaboSet' class, GC-MS samples now deconvolved.

title: Deconvolution of compounds in samples — deconvolveComp
text: See eRah vignette details. open vignette, execute following code R: vignette("eRahManual", package="erah") eRah uses multivariate methods run-time performance depend amount data analyzed. peaks wider #' scans per second also small value, number points (scans) define peak might many, leading eRah poor run#'-time performance. solve , use .sample=TRUE allow eRah define peak 10 seconds, analyze data #' efficiently.

title: Deconvolution of compounds in samples — deconvolveComp
text: [1] Xavier Domingo-Almenara, et al., eRah: Computational Tool Integrating Spectral Deconvolution Alignment Quantification Identification Metabolites GC-MS-Based Metabolomics. Analytical Chemistry (2016). DOI: 10.1021/acs.analchem.6b02927

title: Deconvolution of compounds in samples — deconvolveComp
text: Xavier Domingo-Almenara. xavier.domingo@urv.cat

title: Deconvolution of compounds in samples — deconvolveComp
code: if (FALSE) { # Deconvolve data from a created experiment by \code{\link{newExp}}. # ex <- newExp(instrumental="path")  # The following will set eRah for analyzing the chromatograms # from minutes 5 to 15, and withouth taking into account the masses # 35:69,73:75,147:149, with a minimum peak width of 0.7 seconds.  ex.dec.par <- setDecPar(min.peak.width=0.7, min.peak.height=5000,                         noise.threshold=500, avoid.processing.mz=c(35:69,73:75,147:149),                         analysis.time=c(5,15))  # An now deconvolve the compounds in the samples: # ex <- deconvolveComp(ex, decParameters=ex.dec.par) }

title: Find a compound — findComp
text: findComp returns S3 object: DB.Id identification number library. metbolite reference library different DB.Id number. Compound Name Compound Name. CAS CAS number Formula Chemical Formula.

title: Find a compound — findComp
code: # finding proline  findComp("proline") #>   DB.Id           Compound Name      CAS      Formula #> 1    42        L-Proline (2TMS) 147-85-3 C11H25NO2Si2 #> 2   406 L-Hydroxyproline (3TMS)  51-35-4 C14H33NO3Si3  # be careful, exact matches are not supported,  # as well as different names like these cases:  findComp("L-proline (2TMS)") #> [1] DB.Id         Compound Name CAS           Formula       #> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)   findComp("proline 2") #> [1] DB.Id         Compound Name CAS           Formula       #> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)

text: [1] Xavier Domingo-Almenara, et al., eRah: Computational Tool Integrating Spectral Deconvolution Alignment Quantification Identification Metabolites GC-MS-Based Metabolomics. Analytical Chemistry (2016). DOI: 10.1021/acs.analchem.6b02927

title: New Experiment — newExp
text: Xavier Domingo-Almenara. xavier.domingo@urv.cat

title: New Experiment — newExp
code: if (FALSE) { library(gcspikelite) data(targets)  files <- list.files(system.file('data',package = 'gcspikelite'),full.names = TRUE) files <- files[sapply(files,grepl,pattern = 'CDF')]  instrumental <- createInstrumentalTable(files) phenotype <- createPhenoTable(files,as.character(targets$Group[order(targets$FileName)]))  ex <- newExp(instrumental = instrumental,  phenotype = phenotype, info = "DEMO Experiment") }

title: Plotting sample chromatogram — plotChr
text: Experiment 'MetaboSet' S4 object containing experiment. N.sample Integer. number sample query. type type plotting, Base Ion Chromatogram (BIC), Total Ion Chromatogram (TIC), Extracted Ion Chromatogram (EIC). xlim range minutes, separated comas: c(rt.min, rt.max) limits plotting. default, chromatogram plotted. mz Just EIC selected. range separated comas: c(mz.min, mz.max) vector numbers: c(50,67,80), masses ploted.

title: Plotting chromatographic profile — plotProfile
text: Experiment 'MetaboSet' S4 object containing experiment deconolved, aligned (optionally) identified. AlignId Id identificator compound shown. per.class logical. TRUE (default) profiles shown one color per class, FALSE one color per sample. xlim x axsis (retention time) limits (see plot.default). cols vector colors. Colors used cyclically.

title: Plotting chromatographic profile — plotProfile
text: Xavier Domingo-Almenara. xavier.domingo@urv.cat

title: Plotting Spectra — plotSpectra

title: Plotting Spectra — plotSpectra
code: plotSpectra(Experiment, AlignId, n.putative = 1, compare = T, id.database = mslib, comp.db = NULL,  return.spectra = F, draw.color = "purple", xlim = NULL)  # S4 method for MetaboSet plotSpectra(   Experiment,   AlignId,   n.putative = 1,   compare = T,   id.database = mslib,   comp.db = NULL,   return.spectra = F,   draw.color = "purple",   xlim = NULL )

title: Plotting Spectra — plotSpectra
text: Experiment 'MetaboSet' S4 object containing experiment deconolved, aligned (optionally) identified. AlignId Id identificator compound shown. n.putative hit number (position) returned comparing empirical spectrum reference. See details compare logical. TRUE, reference spectrum library shown comparison. id.database mass-spectra library compared empirical spectra. default, MassBank-[2] - Mass Bank North America (MoNa) database employed. comp.db want compare empirical spectrum another spectrum database, select comp.db number database. return.spectra logical. TRUE, function returns empirical spectrum selected compound draw.color Selects color reference spectrum (see colors). xlim x axsis (mass - m/z) limits (see plot.default).

title: Plotting Spectra — plotSpectra
text: plotSpectra returns vector return.spectra=TRUE. x vector. Containts empirical spectrum.

title: Plotting Spectra — plotSpectra
text: identification applied (see identifyComp), number hits returned (n.putative) selected. Therefore, can compare empirical spectrum (found eRah) n.putative hit returned (1, 2, ...) (see identifyComp).

Funatsu, F. Matsuura, T. Soga, R. Taguchi, K. Saito T. Nishioka, J. Mass Spectrom., 45, 703-714 (2010)

title: Missing compound recovery — recMissComp
text: Experiment 'MetaboSet' S4 object containing experiment data previously created newExp, deconvolved deconvolveComp aligned alignComp. min.samples minimum number samples compound appear considered searching rest samples compound missing. free.model TRUE, spectra found samples compound missing used get final average spectra. (See details)

title: Missing compound recovery — recMissComp
text: function returns updated S4 'MetaboSet' class, GC-MS samples now aligned.

title: Missing compound recovery — recMissComp
text: WARNING: compounds previously identified, identified applying "recMissComp" function. means "identifyComp" function executed always "recMissComp" identification compounds, even "identifyComp" previously applied . free.model parameter recomended always FALSE (except carbon tracking applications). spectra samples compound missing usually affected noise, decrease matching score certain compound.

title: Set Alignment Parameters — setAlPar
text: Setting alignment parameters eRah.

title: Set Alignment Parameters — setAlPar
code: setAlPar(min.spectra.cor, max.time.dist,mz.range = c(70:600))

title: Set Alignment Parameters — setAlPar
text: min.spectra.cor Minimum spectral correlation value. 0 (non similar) 1 (similar). value sets similar two compounds considered alignment . max.time.dist Maximum retention time distance. value (seconds) sets far two compounds can considered alignment . mz.range range masses considered comparing spectra.

title: Set Alignment Parameters — setAlPar
text: [1] Xavier Domingo-Almenara, et al., eRah: Computational Tool Integrating Spectral Deconvolution Alignment Quantification Identification Metabolites GC-MS-Based Metabolomics. Analytical Chemistry (2016). DOI: 10.1021/acs.analchem.6b02927

title: Set Alignment Parameters — setAlPar
text: Xavier Domingo-Almenara. xavier.domingo@urv.cat

title: Set Alignment Parameters — setAlPar
code: if (FALSE) { # The following will set eRah for aligning compounds which are # at least 90 (per cent) similar, and which peaks are at a  # maximum distance of 2 seconds. All the masses are considered when # computing the spectral similarity.  ex.al.par <- setAlPar(min.spectra.cor=0.90, max.time.dist=2, mz.range=1:600) }

title: Set Software Parameters — setDecPar
text: Sets Software Parameters eRah.

title: Set Software Parameters — setDecPar
code: setDecPar(   min.peak.width,   min.peak.height = 2500,   noise.threshold = 500,   avoid.processing.mz = c(73:75, 147:149),   compression.coef = 2,   analysis.time = 0 )

title: Set Software Parameters — setDecPar
text: min.peak.width Minimum compound peak width (seconds). critical parameter conditions efficiency eRah. Typically, half mean compound width. min.peak.height Minimum compound peak height noise.threshold Data threshold considered noise avoid.processing.mz masses want considered processing. Typically, GC-MS masses 73,74,75,147,148 149, since ubiquitous mass fragments typically generated compounds carrying trimethylsilyl moiety. compression.coef Data compressed using orthogonal signal deconvolution (OSD) algorithm according value. level 2 compression recomended. analysis.time chromatographic retention time window process. 0, chromatogram processed.

title: Set Software Parameters — setDecPar
text: See eRah vignette details. open vignette, execute following code R: vignette("eRahManual", package="erah")

title: Set Software Parameters — setDecPar
text: [1] Xavier Domingo-Almenara, et al., eRah: Computational Tool Integrating Spectral Deconvolution Alignment Quantification Identification Metabolites GC-MS-Based Metabolomics. Analytical Chemistry (2016). DOI: 10.1021/acs.analchem.6b02927

title: Set Software Parameters — setDecPar
text: Xavier Domingo-Almenara. xavier.domingo@urv.cat

title: Set Software Parameters — setDecPar
code: if (FALSE) { # The following will set eRah for analyzing the chromatograms #from minutes 5 to 15, and withouth taking into account the masses #35:69,73:75,147:149, widht a minimum peak widht of 0.7 seconds. ex.dec.par <- setDecPar(min.peak.width = 0.7,                          min.peak.height = 5000,                          noise.threshold = 500,                          avoid.processing.mz = c(35:69,73:75,147:149),                          analysis.time = c(5,15)) }

title: Show RT-RI curve — showRTRICurve
text: function uses RI mslib database RT identified compounds discrimine proper compound identification.

title: Show RT-RI curve — showRTRICurve
code: showRTRICurve(   Experiment,   reference.list,   nAnchors = 4,   ri.thrs = "1R",   id.database = mslib )

title: Show RT-RI curve — showRTRICurve
text: Experiment S4 object experiment Data, Metadata Results. Results experiment used extract RT Compound DB Id. reference.list List compounds attributes (AlignId...) nAnchors desired equivalent number degrees freedom smooth.spline function ri.thrs Retention Index treshold given user discrimine bewteen identification results id.database Name preloaded database (mslib default, regular db used erah)

title: Show RT-RI curve — showRTRICurve
text: See eRah vignette details. open vignette, execute following code R: vignette("eRahManual", package="erah")

title: Show RT-RI curve — showRTRICurve
text: [1] Xavier Domingo-Almenara, et al., eRah: Computational Tool Integrating Spectral Deconvolution Alignment Quantification Identification Metabolites GC-MS-Based Metabolomics. Analytical Chemistry (2016). DOI: 10.1021/acs.analchem.6b02927

title: Show RT-RI curve — showRTRICurve
text: Xavier Domingo-Almenara. xavier.domingo@urv.cat
